column4: Hey guys. My laptop's wireless won't connect to my wireless network, but it shows it. My drivers are installed. Advice?
double check mac filtering on your router, and encryption type and key
I did, everything is the same
I was connected about 7 hours ago, shut off my laptop before going to work, came back and it's not connecting
I was going to suggest checking the "wireless off" button on your laptop, but you said you can see the access point?
Yes, it's just that I start connecting and then the connection drops
I know that the adapter is fine because aircrack-ng is showing activity in terminal, the connection just won't stay up
what about signal strength?
fluctuating at about -30 power, so basically full strength
check dmesg
It associates and then deauthenticates itself
Ive had that problem with a faulty antenna or maybe it was a driver problem. I had to use a static ip and try 3-4 times before it would stop acting like that
Everything is unchanged, though. The driver shouldn't stop working and the antenna is fine
yeah I agree. maybe reboot the access point or check for mac conflicts?
I ran dhclient wlan0 and I can ping the router
so it's definitely something in the GUI
network-manager is one of the first things i kill, I use wpa_supplicant. maybe try deleting your entry for your AP in n-m and add it again
I think you're going to love this, by the way, but I just fixed it by turning the wireless on the laptop on and off.
hehe nice
It's disgusting, I should have thought of that first. Well, thanks haha
I imagine the laptop went to sleep while you were at work?
I guess so, and lucid must not agree with turning the adapter back on when it wakes up
